abstract: Upcoming auction of Nobel prize won by economist Simon Kuznets in 1971 highlights difficulty of pricing an object with little market history; only handful of Nobel prizes have been auctioned in the past, with prices ranging from the low five figures to the millions; opening bid for Kuznets's medal will be $150,000, though it remains unclear whether his accomplishments are well-known enough to fetch a high price.
lead_paragraph: The medal awarded in 1971 to the economist who created standard measures of national income and economic growth is on the auction block.

headline.main: Putting a Price on Simon Kuznets’s Nobel in Economics
headline.print_headline: The Challenge of Putting a Price on an Economist’s Nobel Medal

snippet: The medal awarded in 1971 to the economist who created standard measures of national income and economic growth is on the auction block.
